text: Omakase at @katachisushibar. IMO very value for money Omakase! We were lucky to be the only customers for the 8-10pm slot, so we had undivided attention from the chef. Mineno san kept us entertained and well fed throughout the night it was good vibes all the way! Favourites of the night were the Bafun Uni and Aka Ebi they were so sweet! ğŸ˜‹
Wonderful experience dining at Katachi Sushi Bar! Came here with our 5 months old baby and still having the best time of our life! Will definitely come back again to support Mine-San!

Enjoyed a really cozy dinner at Katachi. We went quite hungry and had the Fuji set which is so reasonably priced and left us feeling very satisfied. Consistently good quality and decent variety throughout the courses. Also appreciated the chefâ€™s quiet observations of us and timely interjections on how to consume each course as we were clearly inexperienced omakase diners ğŸ˜‚ Thank you so much for the complimentary birthday dessert as well, it was a sweet gesture!

It was also a rather quiet evening with only two parties before us (left shortly after we arrived) and one after us (we left shortly after they arrived). The privacy and lack of time limit was great so Iâ€™m torn between gatekeeping this gem and hoping more people would find out about them. Would definitely recommend.

Disclaimer: I am a very very picky eater yet somehow katachi sushi bar had me eating every single thing they served!!

The shop is a small and quaint 11 seater sushi bar tucked in a cozy corner of Orchard Plaza.  (Didnâ€™t manage to get pics bcos I was too hungry and focused on foodğŸ˜…)

The food was super super super goodğŸ¤¤ the sashimi was fresh and the sushis were super well paired with little toppings like the Japanese pepper or yuzu. I think I missed out  some dishes because they just looked too good that I only remembered to take pics after I had finished themğŸ˜… the whole menu reminded me a lot of JapanğŸ’–

If the food doesnâ€™t already win you over, then the service definitely will! The chef is super friendly, welcome and knowledgeable about the products. He is also very observant and detail oriented. I told him that I donâ€™t eat spring onions and he was able to remember and follow through by not including spring onions in anything he served me (any spring onions in the photos was because I was taking a picture of someone elseâ€™s food for aesthetic purposesğŸ˜…). He is also really astute. He bases the portion sizes off how full you seem to ensure you can make it through the 12 rounds of sushi and are able to try everything! (We only found this out because we asked). The amount of care and detail really tied together and elevated the whole dining experience.

It was also my friendâ€™s birthday so we got a free dessert (matcha ice cream in a wafer!)ğŸ¨ I love the playlist and the ambience too! It was young, on trend and very vibesğŸ˜

TLDR: overall a really lovely place to dine at, especially if you are celebrating a milestone! Food and service are incredible and I highly recommend this placeğŸ©·

Found this hidden gem at the first floor of orchard plaza. Came here a couple of weeks ago for dinner. Very reasonable price. Think we took the $90+ set. Sushi was fresh.

Chef Bryan was really dedicated, constantly looking at our facial expressions each time we eat, but since itâ€™s so good our expression stayed the same. Tried his sake he produced as well

8/10
